Steps

  1. Randomly initialize the k-means, \(\mu \lower 2pt{k}\), associated with the clusters and compute the probability that each data point \(x \lower 2pt{i}\) is a member of a provided cluster K.
  2. Assume a fixed number of clusters, K.
  3. Repeat until convergence.
  4. Recalculate the centroid of the cluster as the weighted centroid if the probabilities of membership of all data points \(x \lower 2pt{i}\) is \(\mu \lower 2pt{k} (n+1)= {\sum_{x \lower 2pt{i} \in k}x \lower 2pt{i} \times P(\mu \lower 2pt{k}|x \lower 2pt{i})^b \over \sum_{x \lower 2pt{i} \in k} P(\mu \lower 2pt{k}|x \lower 2pt{i})^b }\).
